meanings.definition: In a position on the same side as an opponent's goal or in a position where a player is not offside.
meanings.sent1: The player was onside when he received the pass near the goal.
meanings.sent2: The referee confirmed that the goal was valid as the player was onside.
meanings.sent3: It's a relief to see the player onside this time, no more controversial calls!
meanings.sent4: Being onside is like being in the safe zone near the goal.
meanings.sent5: Make sure you stay onside to avoid any penalties during the game.

meanings.definition: Allowed or permitted by the rules of a game or sport.
meanings.sent1: The move was onside according to the game rules.
meanings.sent2: Only onside tackles are allowed in this match.
meanings.sent3: The coach praised the team for their onside play throughout the game.
meanings.sent4: Staying onside is crucial to avoid fouls and penalties.
meanings.sent5: Players must always be onside to play fairly and follow the rules.
